newsletter.title: Newsletter
newsletter.text: ¿RIT/MO? Early access to 2025 festival news, dates, ticket sales and more.

about.title: What is RIT/MO?
about.slogan: Music, Nature, and Other Cultural Expressions
about.intro: RIT/MO is a unique electronic music festival, combining an intimate environment in the middle of nature with an impressive lineup of national and international artists. A luxury for lovers of electronic music.
about.text: The premier Spanish electronic music festival
about.text2: RIT/MO is undoubtedly something unusual within the national and international panorama of electronic music festivals. There are many characteristics that make it different, but among them the most notable are that it is a festival with a very small capacity, and that it is celebrated in the middle of nature. Although it presents the festival format, organizing its musical offering over two days and having two stages, the truth is that it has nothing to do with macro festivals. You dance with enough space, there are no hated lines to enter, order at the bar, bathrooms, etc., and the venue has the magic of being located in the foothills of Sierra Elvira (Atarfe, Granada) in an environment where dancing becomes special.
about.text3: Although RIT/MO is an event with a reduced capacity, this does not mean that it does not bet on a lineup with top-level artists (and without this implying prohibitive subscription prices!!).

previous.title: Previous editions
previous.intro: Some photos of good times at past events.

accommodation.title: Recommendations for accommodation
accommodation.intro: In Granada or in nearby towns or next to the town of Atarfe. Check out these recommendations for accommodation.

granada.title: In Granada
granada.text: It is located only 15 minutes by car from the festival site. Although you can go to the festival by car since private parking is offered, we recommend that you take the bus. If you are staying in Granada, you can take the round-trip buses that the organization will enable.

pueblos.title: In closer towns
pueblos.text: A second option is to stay in some of the closest towns to the festival site. If this is done, we recommend going to the festival by taxi in groups of 3-4 people. The closest town is Atarfe, 8 minutes by car. If you choose this option, the price of the one-way taxi is around €10 one way. We recommend arranging the return trip with a 24-hour taxi service (the price of the taxi on the return increases to around €15 or €18 as you have to call it to come to the premises to pick up users).
pueblos.note: If you call the taxi at the end of each day of the festival, you will have to wait due to the high demand at those times. There is no taxi or Uber stop on the festival grounds, so the return trip by taxi must be made by calling one of the available taxi services.

atarfe.title: Next to the town of Atarfe
atarfe.text: Next to the town of Atarfe, for accommodation we recommend Albolote, located 10 minutes by car. Although it is a few minutes further from the venue, this town has a Tram service from the town to the city of Granada. If you want to visit Granada, the Tram option is very convenient. For the rest of the towns near the venue, if you want to go to Granada, you must take public buses.

airports.title: Flight and airport guide
airports.intro: If you are planning to join us to enjoy the best electronic dance music, and for this you plan to use the plane as a means of transportation, here you have useful information about the closest airports and how to get to Granadafrom there.

granada.title: Federico García Lorca Granada-Jaén Airport (GRX)
granada.text: Located approximately 15 kilometers west of Granada. This is the closest airport to the city. Due to its proximity to the city of Granada it is the most convenient option, although its direct international connections are scarce.
granada.how: How to get from the airport to Granada:
granada.taxi: Taxis are available outside the airport terminal. The trip to Granada takes around 20 minutes, depending on traffic, with a cost of approximately €28.
granada.bus: Without a doubt the best way, or at least the cheapest, to get from Granada airport to the center is with the bus service operated by the company ALSA. The bus drops you off in the center of the city for only 3 euros. The bus stop is right at the exit of the arrivals terminal, you can't miss it since the airport is small, and the ticket is bought from the driver without having to reserve it in advance. The company organizes the schedules depending on the arrivals and departures of the flights. Today the bus schedules that go from the airport to the center of Granada operate from 6 a.m. to 11:30 p.m., and in the opposite direction from 5 a.m. to 9:45 p.m.

malaga.title: Malaga Airport (AGP)
malaga.text: Although a little further away (approximately 135 kilometers south of Granada), Malaga Airport is an important international hub with a wide variety of flights. It is a good alternative for those looking for more flight options.
malaga.how: How to get there from Malaga airport:
malaga.rent: For those who prefer flexibility, car rental is an excellent option. Rental services are available at both airports, allowing you to explore the beautiful surroundings of Granada at your own pace.
malaga.bus: There are direct bus services from Malaga Airport to Granada, with a journey time of approximately 2 hours.

location.title: Location
location.large: Natural area Ermita de los Tres Juanes, Atarfe, Granada

faqs.title: FAQs
faqs.intro: We have compiled the most frequently asked questions to assist you with:

doncompr.q: Where can I buy my ticket for RIT/MO?
doncompr.a: Purchase your tickets through our official ticket channel at Tickbox.

puecom.q: Can I buy tickets at the festival?
puecom.a: Yes, you can purchase them at our ticket booths, subject to availability.

noemail.q: I purchased my ticket but haven't received any confirmation email, what should I do?
noemail.a: Please contact TickBox at info@tickbox.es with your full name and purchase date.

nooficial.q: What happens if I buy a ticket from a non-official sales channel?
nooficial.a: RIT/MO cannot guarantee the validity of tickets purchased from non-official sales channels.

perdida.q: What should I do if I lose my ticket?
perdida.a: Ensure the ticket has not been used by someone else. Only the first ticket presented at the entrance will be considered valid. Any subsequent tickets with the same code will be deemed invalid.

atencli.q: How can I contact customer service?
atencli.a: If your query is not addressed here, please contact us at info@ritmofestival.com.

factura.q: Can I receive an invoice for my ticket purchase?
factura.a: Your ticket serves as an invoice. However, if you are a business, you can request an invoice by emailing info@tickbox.es.

devolentr.q: Can I return or modify my ticket after purchase?
devolentr.a: Tickets are non-refundable and cannot be modified after purchase.

tqlls.q: Are there lockers available on site?

objper.q: Is there a lost and found service?
objper.a: Yes, if you find or lose an item at RIT/MO, please visit the information point.

comglu.q: Can I buy gluten-free, vegetarian, or vegan food at RIT/MO?
comglu.a: Yes, we offer a variety of food options to accommodate different dietary needs.

cerveglu.q: Can I purchase gluten-free beer at RIT/MO?

comprataba.q: Is tobacco available for purchase at the venue?
comprataba.a: No, tobacco is not sold at the festival.

internet.a: No. The venue has mobile coverage, although we cannot guarantee connectivity quality.

banoreduci.q: Are there accessible restrooms for people with reduced mobility?
banoreduci.a: Yes, we provide accessible facilities for individuals with reduced mobility.

acampa.q: Is there a camping area at RIT/MO?
acampa.a: No, there is no camping area available at the festival.

accanima.q: Can I bring animals to the venue?
accanima.a: Animals are not allowed, with the exception of guide dogs for visually impaired individuals, which must be properly identified.

accamara.q: Am I allowed to enter with a camera?
accamara.a: Entrance with professional photography, video cameras, drones, or selfie sticks is prohibited.

objgrand.q: Can I bring my motorcycle helmet or other large transport items like skateboards or bicycles?
objgrand.a: No, entry with large items such as suitcases, large bags, backpacks, skateboards, or motorcycle helmets is not allowed. Additionally, objects deemed dangerous by the organization, such as aerosols, laser pointers, and sharp objects, are also prohibited.

edadmin.q: What is the minimum age requirement to access RIT/MO?
edadmin.a: Minors are permitted entry when accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. Minors aged 10 and above must purchase a ticket. An authorization and responsibility form for minors must be completed and carried at all times, available here: Authorization Form. The RIT/MO organization reserves the right to request this document at any time.

accreduci.q: Is there access for people with reduced mobility?
accreduci.a: Yes, the festival provides access to the general public area (Espacio Baila) for individuals with reduced mobility.

volveracc.q: Can I re-enter RIT/MO if I leave the venue?

comlleg.q: How do I get to RIT/MO?
comlleg.a: RIT/MO is located at the Natural Area of Ermita de los Tres Juanes in Atarfe, Granada. From Granada, travel via the Circunvalación towards Jaén, taking Exit 238 for Atarfe / Las Canteras, and follow signs to 'La Ermita'.

autobus.q: Is there a bus service to RIT/MO?
autobus.a: Yes, a shuttle bus service is available from Granada, with stops at Centro Comercial Neptuno (Gimnasio O2).

parking.a: Yes, parking is available at the venue for a daily fee. We also recommend using the provided shuttle bus service.

horfest.a: Doors open at 16:30. Live performances run from 17:00 to 4:00, continuously over both days of the festival.

guiavuelos.a: Check our Airport and Transportation Guide for detailed information on airports near Granada and transportation options to the festival.

recaloja.a: Check our recommended accommodations for options near the festival site.

coviprot.q: What COVID-19 protocols will be implemented at the festival?
coviprot.a: We will adhere to guidelines set by health authorities at the time of the festival and will provide updates as the event approaches.
